drinkName.name: Zombie
drinkName.about: This tropical drink by legendary Donn Beach of Don the Beachcomber restaurant kicked off the Tiki craze.

mix.how: Put all of the ingredients in blender, adding 6 oz of crushed ice last.
Blend at high speed for no more than 5 seconds.
Pour into a glass, add ice cubes to fill, then add the garnish.
*Donn’s mix: Bring 3 crushed cinnamon sticks, 1 cup of sugar and 1 cup of water to a boil, stirring until the sugar is dissolved.
Simmer for 2 minutes, then remove from the heat and let sit for at least 2 hours before straining into a clean glass bottle.
Then add 1 part of the syrup and 2 parts of fresh grapefruit juice together.

drinkName.name: Three Dots and a Dash
drinkName.about: This Tiki drink is what an exotic cocktail is all about, with citrus, sweeteners, spice and, of course, rums.

ingredients.ingredient: 3 maraschino cherries on a cocktail pick and 1 pineapple frond (representing Morse Code—three cherries as the three dots and the frond as the dash), for garnish

mix.how: Add all of the ingredients to a drink mixer tin.
Fill with 12 oz of crushed ice and 4 to 6 small “agitator” cubes.
Flash-blend, then open pour with gated finish into a footed pilsner glass and add the garnish.

drinkName.name: Shandy Maker
drinkName.about: This beer cocktail adds a hoppy IPA to 100-proof bourbon, some citrus and the kicker: muddled fresh marjoram, resulting in a variety of summery flavors that blend together nicely.

mix.how: Dry-muddle the marjoram.
Add all of the other ingredients except the beer, and give it a quick stir.
Strain into a pint glass, and add ice.
Top with the beer, and garnish with the grapefruit peel.

drinkName.name: Crownberry Apple
drinkName.about: This whisky cocktail is pretty simple—sort of like an alcoholic version of Ocean Spray Cran-Apple.

mix.how: Add the whisky to a rocks glass over ice.
Top with cranberry juice and stir.
Garnish with an apple wheel.

drinkName.name: Harper’s Bet
drinkName.about: This citrus-infused cocktail takes the idea of a Manhattan and builds upon the classic. Grenadine, citrus and orange bitters combine with bourbon for a slightly sweet, slightly sour concoction.

ingredients.ingredient: I.W. Harper Kentucky straight bourbon whiskey

mix.how: Combine all ingredients in a shaker, and strain over ice in an Old Fashioned glass.
Garnish with a lemon wheel.

drinkName.name: Keeneland Breeze
drinkName.about: Bourbon and orange don’t usually go together, unless it’s a slice dropped into an Old Fashioned, but this cocktail adds a splash of orange liqueur to bourbon and tops it off with ginger ale to counter the sweetness.

mix.how: Fill rocks glass with ice.
Add the bourbon, orange curaçao liqueur and a squeeze of fresh orange and stir.
Top off with ginger ale, and garnish with an orange wedge.

drinkName.name: Northern Harvest Buck
drinkName.about: This take on the Whiskey Ginger (a.k.a the Irish Buck) adds a squeeze of lime and some bitters, which complement the slightly spicy but smooth Crown Royal Northern Harvest rye.

mix.how: Combine the rye and lime juice in a shaker with ice, and shake well.
Strain into a highball glass over ice.
Add 2 dashes of Angostura bitters, and top with ginger beer.
Garnish with a lemon wheel and mint sprig.

drinkName.name: Emerald
drinkName.about: You could say this is the Irish version of a Manhattan.

mix.how: Stir the whiskey, vermouth and bitters with cracked ice for 30 seconds, then strain into a chilled cocktail glass and garnish with an orange peel.
Stir the bourbon, falernum and coconut water with ice, then strain into a chilled cocktail coupe, and top with the bitters.

Shake the tequila, liqueur, Pok Pok Som and lime juice with ice, top with the pilsner, and strain into a chilled ice-filled Pilsner glass rimmed with a blend of one part La Bôite NYC Izak N.37 and four parts kosher salt.
Add all of the ingredients in a mixing glass, stir and strain into a coupe.
Place the glass on an oak board with an oak barrel behind it.
Add all of the ingredients to a mixing glass and stir.
Strain into a coupe.
Express oils from an orange diamond, and wipe the rim with it.
Hang the orange diamond on the rim of the glass for garnish.
In a mixing glass, add the bitters, followed by the liqueurs and vermouth and then the bourbon.
Add ice and stir for medium dilution.
Strain over a large piece of chipped block ice into a rocks glass.
Finish with a spritz of Islay scotch.
Grab a Lewis bag, and crack several pieces of large-format ice.
In a mixing glass, add the absinthe followed by the bitters, vermouth and bourbon.
Add the cracked ice and stir.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and garnish with a lemon twist.
Combine all ingredients in a pre-iced mixing glass, pouring the bourbon last, and stir until properly diluted and chilled (usually 40 to 50 rotations).
Place a Julep strainer over the glass, and pour over ice into a rocks glass.
For the garnish, cut a long channel out of an unwaxed lemon with a channel knife.
Wrap the channel around the base of a small bunch of mint, and tie into a simple knot.
In a pre-iced mixing glass, pour in the bourbon and both vermouths.
Dash in your bitters and, with a stirring spoon, stir all of your ingredients until properly chilled and diluted (on average, 40 to 50 rotations).
Place a Julep strainer over the mixing vessel, and strain the cocktail into a pre-chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a speared Luxardo maraschino cherry.

ingredients.ingredient: Woodford Reserve Bourbon Barrel Aged Sassafras & Sorghum bitters

mix.how: Add the bourbon, sorel, syrup and bitters to a Yarai mixing glass.
Add ice and stir well.
Put an ice sphere in stemmed Old Fashioned glass.
Double-strain to glass, and garnish with bruleed figs.
Add the bourbon, vermouth and bitters to Yarai mixing glass.
Add ice and stir well.
Add all ingredients in shaker tin, dry shake, wet shake and strain into chilled coupe.
Garnish with drops of Angostura bitters in the foam.
Combine all ingredients except the curaçao in mixing glass, and add ice.
Stir to standard dilution.
Rinse a coupe with the curaçao.
Strain into a chilled and rinsed coupe.
Garnish with one Fabbri amarena cherry and manicured orange swath.
Combine all ingredients except the tea in a tabletop electric tea kettle.
Bring to a boil and quickly remove.
Place the tea in a tea strainer, and place the strainer over a pouring vessel.
Pour the hot cocktail over the tea, and discard the tea.
Add a large ice cube to an Old Fashioned glass.
Slowly pour the hot mixture over the ice cube.
Express a lemon twist over the cocktail and discard. Serve.
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass, beginning with the bitters, and top with ice.
Stir (54 times) and strain into a chilled coupe.Stir (54 times) and strain into a chilled coupe.
Express lemon twist over the drink, and then drop it into the cocktail.

drinkName.name: Corpse Reviver 212
drinkName.about: Presented by Chivas

mix.how: Combine Chivas Regal 12 Year Old, coconut water, cold brew coffee, and palm sugar syrup in a mixing glass.
Separately, use a hand blender or dry shake to lightly whip and combine heavy cream and vanilla salt, then set aside.
Add ice to mixing glass, stir gently to chill and lightly dilute, then pour contents into a chilled pousse-café glass.
Using the back of a bar spoon, float the vanilla salted cream over the top of the drink, then garnish with additional vanilla salt.

drinkName.name: Rampart Rambler
drinkName.about: This cocktail was created by Steven Lucas at Raised for Cognac Classics Week, presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.

mix.how: Cut off one third of the vanilla bean (reserve the rest for another use), scrape the seeds into a mixing glass, and add the remaining ingredients.
Fill with ice and stir.
Strain into a coupe, and garnish with an orange peel and the spent vanilla bean fragment.

drinkName.name: Zen Café Racer
drinkName.about: This cocktail was created by Nahm Kim at Sunda for Cognac Classics Week, presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.

mix.how: Add all of the ingredients to a shaker, and fill with ice.
Shake and strain into a snifter glass.
To garnish, twist an orange peel over the surface of the glass to express its oils, then discard.
Float the star anise in the glass.

drinkName.name: Vieux Carré
drinkName.about: This cocktail was created by Dustin Drankiewicz at Moneygun for Cognac Classics Week, presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.

mix.how: Add all of the ingredients to a mixing glass, and fill with ice.
Stir and strain into a bucket glass with 1 fresh ice cube.
Garnish by twisting a lemon peel over the surface of the drink to express its oils, then drop the peel into the glass.

drinkName.name: The Classic
drinkName.about: This cocktail was created by Colleen Healy at Pops for Cognac Classics Week, presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.

mix.how: Place the sugar cube in a chilled coupe glass and saturate with the bitters.
Add the cognac to the glass and top with the Champagne.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: French 75
drinkName.about: This cocktail was created by Dustin Drankiewicz at Promontory for Cognac Classics Week, presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.

mix.how: Add the cognac, lemon juice and sugar to a shaker, and fill with ice.
Shake and strain into a flute, and top with the Champagne.
Garnish by twisting the lemon over the surface of the drink to express its oils, then drop the peel into the drink.

drinkName.name: La Grande Dame
drinkName.about: This cocktail was created by Patrick Henaghan at Roka Akor for Cognac Classics Week, presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.

mix.how: Add the mint leaves, lemon juice, syrup and bitters to a shaking tin and muddle.
Add the cognac, and fill with ice.
Shake and strain into a Collins glass.
Fill with crushed ice and top with Champagne.
Garnish with a mint sprig.

drinkName.name: Démodé
drinkName.about: This cocktail was created by Angie O’Neil at Binny’s for Cognac Classics Week, presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.

ingredients.ingredient: Jo Snow tangerine lavender honey syrup

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass, and fill with ice.
Stir and strain into a rocks glass with 1 fresh ice cube.
Garnish with the orange peel.

drinkName.name: The Japanese
drinkName.about: This cocktail was created by Jon Harris at Virgin for Cognac Classics Week, presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.

mix.how: Add all of the ingredients to a shaker, and fill with ice.
Shake and strain into a Martini glass.
Garnish with a lemon peel.

drinkName.name: Sidecar #2
drinkName.about: This cocktail was created by James Urycki at Langham for Cognac Classics Week, presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.

mix.how: Rim a chilled coupe with sugar.
Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker, and fill with ice.
Shake and strain into the prepared glass.
Flame the orange disc over the surface of the drink, then drop into the glass.

drinkName.about: This cocktail was created by Michael Page at Acanto for Cognac Classics Week, presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.

mix.how: Add all of the ingredients to a shaker, and fill with ice.
Shake and strain into a snifter, and garnish with a lemon peel.

drinkName.name: Mind Eraser
drinkName.about: The cares of the day just simply disappear. It might just be your new favorite nightcap.

ingredients.ingredient:
Coffee liqueur
Try it with Kahlúa

mix.how: Add the coffee liqueur and vodka into a rocks glass over ice.
Top with the club soda.
Serve with a straw.

drinkName.name: Classic Sangria
drinkName.about: This fruity drink from Spain has many variations, but sometimes tradition is the way to go.

mix.how: In a large pitcher, add the sugar, oranges, apples and lemon and muddle for 30 seconds.
Add the brandy and orange juice and muddle again for 30 seconds.
Add the red wine, stir, add ice and serve in a red wine glass.

drinkName.name: Santa Marea
drinkName.about: This cocktail, served at Barcelona gin joint Bobby Gin, is perfect for day drinking.

mix.how: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain and serve neat in a double rocks glass. Garnish with a mounted lemon peel.

drinkName.name: Delorean
drinkName.about: This cocktail is the gin-based, day-drinking sipper of choice at Barcelona’s Polaroid Bar.

mix.how: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain and serve in double rocks glass filled with ice. Garnish with 2 bendy straws.

drinkName.name: Ginger Gin Fizz
drinkName.about: This brunch cocktail, served at Barcelona’s popular Xixbar, is ideal for an early-morning pick-me-up.

mix.how: Shake the gin, lemon and lime juices, simple syrup, egg white and bitters with ice, strain and serve in highball glass with 2 ice cubes.
Fill with club soda. Garnish with an orange peel and 2 bendy straws.

drinkName.name: Salty Dog
drinkName.about: This classic cooler can be made with vodka or gin and is perfect for a warm sunny day.

mix.how: Rim a highball glass with salt.
Shake the vodka (or gin) and grapefruit juice, pour over ice in a highball glass.
Garnish with a grapefruit slice.

drinkName.name: Lucy Colada
drinkName.about: Making your own cannabis-infused liquor that’ll give you a buzz in two ways isn’t as hard as you think. After decarbing your cannabis and infusing your spirit, you can then use that liquor to make this rum and coconut milk cocktail.

mix.how: Add the rum, cannabis-infused coconut milk, pineapple and lemon juice into a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into a rocks filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a pineapple wedge and serve.

drinkName.name: Chill Wave
drinkName.about: Making your own cannabis-infused liquor that’ll give you a buzz in two ways isn’t as hard as you think. After decarbing your cannabis and infusing your spirit, you can then use that liquor to make this mezcal cocktail.

mix.how: Rim a rocks glass with lime juice and press into a plate of tajín spice. Set aside.
Add the cannabis-infused mezcal, lime juice and agave into a shaker with ice.
Shake well and strain into the tajín-rimmed rocks glass with fresh ice.
Add drops of the bitters and serve in a rocks glass.

drinkName.name: VSO Peach
drinkName.about: This cocktail was created by Jeff Bell at PDT for Cognac Classics Week, presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy V.S.O.P Privilège.

ingredients.ingredient: Rare Tea Cellar Champagne Peach Shrubbery

mix.how: Add all of the ingredients except the Champagne to a shaker, and fill with ice.
Shake and strain into a chilled coupe.
Top with the Champagne, and garnish with a mint sprig.

drinkName.name: The Midnight Rider
drinkName.about: This cocktail was created by Jimmy Palumbo at Belle Shoals for Cognac Classics Week, presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.

mix.how: Add all of the ingredients to a mixing glass, and fill with ice.
Stir, then strain into a cocktail glass, and garnish with a brandied cherry.

drinkName.name: Ginger Shandy
drinkName.about: Most popular in western Europe, especially Germany, this two-ingredient beer cocktail is easy to make and refreshing.

mix.how: In a pint glass, combine the lager and ginger ale (or ginger beer).

drinkName.name: Lemon Shandy
drinkName.about: Most popular in western Europe, especially Germany, this two-ingredient beer cocktail is easy to make and refreshing.

mix.how: In a pint glass, combine the lager and Sprite (or 7Up).

drinkName.name: Kalimotxo
drinkName.about: This simple drink, sometimes spelled calimotxo or calimocho, is wildly popular in the Basque Country.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients into a red wine glass with ice.
Garnish with a lemon slice.

drinkName.name: G.C.S.
drinkName.about: The beautiful thing about shrubs is that there are only two rules: something sweet and something acidic. Typically some variety of sugar does the heavy lifting, but here maple syrup offers a perfect hit of character and complexity. And although the beets maybe seem like an odd or unnecessary addition, they actually keep the sweetness in check with a welcome earthiness, and the shrub makes a fantastic mixer in this gin and Campari cocktail.

mix.how: Add the gin, Campari, maple beet shrub and ice to a cocktail shaker and shake well.
Strain into a rocks glass, or coupé if you're feeling fancy.

drinkName.name: Shrub Julep
drinkName.about: The beautiful thing about shrubs is that there are only two rules: something sweet and something acidic. Typically some variety of sugar does the heavy lifting, but here maple syrup offers a perfect hit of character and complexity. And although the beets maybe seem like an odd or unnecessary addition, they actually keep the sweetness in check with a welcome earthiness, and the shrub makes a fantastic mixer in this riff on a Mint Julep.

mix.how: Muddle the mint sprig in a Julep tin (or rocks glass).
Add the maple beet shrub, bourbon and a small scoop of crushed ice and stir.
Top with more crushed ice to fill the glass.
Garnish with a mint sprig.
Serve with a straw.

drinkName.name: Shrubarita
drinkName.about: The beautiful thing about shrubs is that there are only two rules: something sweet and something acidic. Typically some variety of sugar does the heavy lifting, but here maple syrup offers a perfect hit of character and complexity. And although the beets maybe seem like an odd or unnecessary addition, they actually keep the sweetness in check with a welcome earthiness, and the shrub makes a fantastic mixer in this riff on a Margarita.

ingredients.ingredient: Lime juice, plus lime wheel for garnish

mix.how: Add the mezcal, maple beet shrub, lime juice and ice to a cocktail shaker and shake well.

On one plate, pour the maple syrup. On another plate, mix the salt and pepper. Dip the rocks glass in the maple syrup and gently shake to remove excess before dipping into the salt and pepper mixture.
Strain the drink into the prepared glass, and garnish with a lime wheel.

drinkName.name: Maple Beet Shrub
drinkName.about: The beautiful thing about shrubs is that there are only two rules: something sweet and something acidic. From there, your imagination can run wild. Typically some variety of sugar does the heavy lifting, but here maple syrup offers a perfect hit of character and complexity. And although the beets maybe seem like an odd or unnecessary addition, they actually keep the sweetness in check with a welcome earthiness.

ingredients.ingredient: 1-inch piece of ginger, peeled and thinly sliced

mix.how: Peel the beets - cut each into eight wedges, and add to a 1-quart jar along with the ginger, mustard seeds and bay leaf.

In a saucepan, combine the vinegar, maple syrup and salt with 1 cup of water. Stir to combine and bring to a boil over medium heat. Pour enough liquid into the prepared jar to cover the beets and let cool to room temperature.
Refrigerate for at least 12 hours and up to 2 weeks, shaking the jar every few days to distribute the flavors. Makes 1 quart.

drinkName.name: Hennessy Sazerac
drinkName.about: This cocktail was created by Frank Torres at Del Frisco’s Double Eagle Steakhouse for Cognac Classics Week, presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.

mix.how: Rinse a chilled Martini glass with absinthe, discarding any excess, and set aside.
Add the cognac, simple syrup and bitters to a mixing glass, and fill with ice.
Stir and strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with the lemon peel.

drinkName.name: Hennessy Crusta
drinkName.about: This cocktail was created by Nazarene Garcia at Hudson Bar & Books for Cognac Classics Week, presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.

mix.how: Rinse a chilled snifter glass with the whisky, discarding any excess, and set aside.
Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake and strain into the prepared glass over fresh cracked ice.
Garnish with an orange peel.

drinkName.name: Golden Sazerac
drinkName.about: This cocktail was created by Giuseppe González at Suffolk Arms for Cognac Classics Week, presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.

mix.how: Rinse a chilled rocks glass with absinthe, discarding any excess, and set aside.
Add the cognac, bitters and syrup to a mixing glass, and fill with ice.
Stir and strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish by twisting the lemon peel over the surface of the drink to express its oils, then discard.

drinkName.name: Japanese Harvard Fizz
drinkName.about: This cocktail was created by Kenta Goto at Bar Goto for Cognac Classics Week, presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.

mix.how: Add the cognac, plum wine and bitters to a highball glass.
Fill with ice, and top with the soda.
Stir gently to combine.

drinkName.name: Napoleon Julep
drinkName.about: This cocktail was created by Nicholas Bennett at Porchlight for Cognac Classics Week, presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.

mix.how: Add all of the ingredients to a Julep cup or double Old Fashioned glass.
Fill halfway with crushed or pebble ice, then swizzle to chill.
Pack the glass with more ice, forming a mound at the top.
Garnish with the mint and finely grated lemon zest over the surface of the drink.

drinkName.name: Monkey Heart
drinkName.about: This cocktail was created by Scott Kennedy at Distilled for Cognac Classics Week, presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.

mix.how: Rinse a chilled coupe with absinthe, discarding any excess, and set aside.
Add the cognac, grenadine and orange juice to a shaking tin.
Fill with ice and shake well to chill.
Double-strain into the prepared coupe, and garnish with the orange peel.

drinkName.name: Hell’s Potion
drinkName.about: This cocktail was created by Sarah Smith at Putnam’s Pub for Cognac Classics Week, presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.

mix.how: Rinse an Old Fashioned glass with the Chartreuse, discarding any excess, and set aside.
Add the cognac, molasses syrup and bitters to a mixing glass, and fill with ice.
Stir and strain into the prepared glass.
Flame the lemon peel over the surface of the drink, then drop into the glass.

drinkName.name: Corn ’n’ Oil
drinkName.about: This traditional drink from Barbados uses dark, oil-like blackstrap rum.

ingredients.ingredient: Black strap or aged Barbados rum

mix.how: Combine rum, falernum, and lime juice in a rocks glass.
Top with crushed or cracked ice.
Add the bitters and stir ingredients until well chilled. The glass should be frosty.
Top with bitters and serve with a lime wedge.

drinkName.name: Matcha-Sesame Punch
drinkName.about: By adding a jolt of sesame to this milk punch with matcha, the cocktail becomes fuller and rounder, a harmony of fresh green and deep, nutty flavors. Just as sesame successfully amplifies food, it provides another subtle layer to drinks.

mix.how: Combine all ingredients in a shaker tin, and dry shake to aerate. Shake with ice, and fine-strain into a ceramic teacup.

drinkName.name: Gentleman Jack Whiskey Sling
drinkName.about:
Whiskey Sling
Classic Drink. Modern Taste.

mix.how: Shake all ingredients with ice.
Then strain into an ice-filled glass.

drinkName.name: Goldeneye
drinkName.about: This cocktail was created by Ray Quinones at 48 Lounge for Cognac Classics Week, presented by Liquor.com and Hennessy VSOP Privilège.

ingredients.ingredient: Ardbeg Ten Years Old single-malt Scotch whisky

mix.how: Add the cognac, honey-ginger syrup, lemon juice and bitters to a shaker, and fill with ice.
Shake and strain into an Old Fashioned glass over fresh ice.
Top with the whisky, and garnish with the piece of candied ginger on a skewer.

ingredients.ingredient: Pineapple pieces (about the shape of small lime quarter)

mix.how: In a mixing glass muddle the pineapple and add two small grinds of pepper. Add tequila, lime and agave nectar.
Shake and strain over fresh ice in an old-fashioned glass, and float the port.
Combine all ingredients, except ginger beer, to a shaker with ice and shake.
Fine-strain into Collins glass with fresh ice, top with ginger beer and garnish.

ingredients.ingredient:
Blended Scotch whisky
Try it with Chivas Regal

mix.how: Add the blended scotch, juice and syrup into a shaker with ice and shake.
Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.
Top with the single-malt scotch.
Garnish with 1 piece of candied ginger.

*Honey-ginger syrup: Combine 1 cup honey, 1 6-inch piece of peeled and thinly sliced ginger and 1 cup water in a saucepan over high heat, and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium, and simmer 5 minutes. Place in the refrigerator to steep overnight. Strain with a cheesecloth.

drinkName.name: Snap, Chat & Rum
drinkName.about: Did you know that sugar snap peas belong in your cocktails? Here’s a cocktail for your arsenal. It seems like a simple Daiquiri but adds fennel bulb and pressed snap peas to take it to peak freshness. Those ingredients and a high-quality rum will make this one of the best Daiquiris you’ve ever had.

ingredients.ingredient: Pressed sugar snap pea with fennel bulb

mix.how: Shake and strain all ingredients into chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with fennel frond.

drinkName.name: Whisky in Church
drinkName.about: Though a bit rare, this smoky whisky cocktail is delicious when made well.

mix.how: Stir all ingredients together with ice.
Serve over fresh ice, and add a lemon twist for garnish.

drinkName.name: Pisco Sour
drinkName.about: The addition of gum syrup lends silky richness to this frothy classic.

mix.how: Combine the first five ingredients in a shaker.
Dry shake for 15 seconds, then add ice and shake again to chill.
Double strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Dot the top with drops of Angostura bitters.

drinkName.name: Wagyu
drinkName.about: This inventive cocktail could only come from the mind of Richard Woods at Sushisamba London, where he puts a richly-flavored spin on the Old Fashioned with wagyu-beef-fat–washed Japanese whisky.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and lightly mix.
Add ice to the shaker and stir to chill.
Strain, and pour into rocks glass over ice.

drinkName.name: The Dana Scully
drinkName.about: The Dana Scully is a smoky, spirit-forward sipper. Like its namesake agent, the Mezcal, Cynar, Cointreau and raspberry liqueur creation is a striking burnt vermillion. It’s a no-nonsense recipe for a no-nonsense agent.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass over ice.
Stir, and strain into a coupe.
Garnish with an orange twist.

drinkName.name: The Fox Mulder
drinkName.about: This X-Files–inspired cocktail is a classic Whiskey Sour with a pineapple twist. A Green Chartreuse float gives the drink an ethereal appearance, but the high-proof, medicinal bite keeps it grounded.

mix.how: Add all ingredients except the Green Chartreuse to a shaker filled with ice.
Shake, and strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.
Top with a float of Green Chartreuse.
Add the date, salt, cumin and lime juice to a shaker. Let sit for 5 minutes, then muddle well so the date is pulverized.
Add ice and shake until chilled, then pour the contents of the shaker into a tall glass.
Fill to the rim with ginger beer and stir well to combine. Garnish with a mint sprig.

drinkName.name: Puerto Vallarta
drinkName.about: Tequila and verjus make fine bedfellows in this fragrant glass topped with bubbles.

mix.how: Combine all ingredients except club soda in a wine glass.
Top with soda and garnish with lemongrass and mandarin peel.

drinkName.name: Fennel 75
drinkName.about: Turn the French 75 on its head by swapping in tequila, fennel liqueur and honey syrup and topping with bubbles.

mix.how: Add all ingredients except sparkling wine to a shaker with ice.
Shake, and strain into a flute over ice.
Top with sparkling wine and garnish with a fennel frond.

drinkName.name: Celery Daisy
drinkName.about: Fresh celery juice adds bright, earthy undertones to this tequila-based cocktail made with elderflower liqueur and Fino sherry.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice.
Shake, and strain into a rocks glass over one large ice cube.
Garnish with lime wheel and celery leaf.

drinkName.name: Lawless Liter
drinkName.about: Meet the ensemble cast critics will cheer for, featuring heavy-hitters like tequila, Yellow Chartreuse and velvet falernum.

mix.how: Combine all ingredients in a pitcher.
Briefly stir with ice, strain, and funnel into an empty punch bowl.
Refrigerate remaining punch for later use.
Combine all ingredients except for Champagne ahead of time and chill in refrigerator.
Pour into a flute and top with the Champagne.
Garnish with a lemon twirl or scrape of nutmeg.

ingredients.ingredient: Crème of choice (cassis, mure, abricot, framboise, fraises des bois)

mix.how: Pour chilled Crémant into a wine glass, then slowly add the crème.
Add all ingredients to a shaker filled with ice. Shake well, and strain into a cocktail glass.
Add all ingredients to a shaker filled with ice. Shake, and strain into a chilled coupe or cocktail glass.
In a chilled rocks glass, muddle the sugar, bitters, orange wedge and cherry into a thick paste, being careful not to work the orange peel.
Add brandy, stir and fill the glass with ice.

drinkName.name: Sparkling Apple Punch
drinkName.about: A smoked honey syrup and spicy bitters lend subtle heat to this tequila-based party punch that serves eight to ten people.

mix.how: Combine all ingredients except sparkling wine in a punch bowl with two cups of ice.
Stir to combine and chill.
Top with sparkling wine and apple slices for garnish.
Add large chunks of punch ice to the bowl to keep it cold while minimizing dilution.

drinkName.name: Sandeman Sparkler
drinkName.about: Port and sparkling wine make a perfect holiday duo that’s easy as can be.

mix.how: Add port to a Champagne flute and top with sparkling wine.

drinkName.name: Ciderhouse Punch
drinkName.about: Entertaining a crowd? This port-based punch will happily serve a group of 20.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a punch bowl with ice and stir well.
Garnish with sliced apples and lemons.

drinkName.name: Beelzebub
drinkName.about: Mezcal lends a note of fire and brimstone to this bittersweet bourbon cocktail.

ingredients.ingredient: I.W. Harper Kentucky straight bourbon whiskey

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice.
Shake, and strain into a coupette.
Garnish with nutmeg.

drinkName.name: 5 Keys
drinkName.about: Earthy Cynar and Maraschino liqueur balance each other in this smooth bourbon-based coupe.

ingredients.ingredient: Blade & Bow Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice.
Stir, and strain into a coupette.

drinkName.name: Blue Milk of Tatooine
drinkName.about: Channel the alien planet from Star Wars with this creamy combination of gin, coconut cream and blue curaçao.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice.
Shake, and strain into a milk bottle or Collins glass.

drinkName.name: Planet Hoth Toddy
drinkName.about: Recall Planet Hoth, the world of snow and ice, with this rum-based coupe laced with lime juice and maraschino liqueur.

ingredients.ingredient: Bacardi Gran Reserva Maestro de Ron

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice.
Shake vigorously, and double strain into a coupe.
Garnish with nutmeg.

drinkName.name: Jubilee
drinkName.about: This festive vodka creation is cause for celebration thanks to the additions of red wine, spiced pear liqueur and maple syrup.

mix.how: Add all ingredients except seltzer to a glass over ice.
Stir and top with seltzer.
Garnish with a pear fan and grated nutmeg.

drinkName.name: Psycho Killer
drinkName.about: White cacao and banana liqueur balance the dry, bitter duo of cocoa nibs and Campari in this elegant Irish whiskey cocktail from The Dead Rabbit.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice.
Stir, and strain into a Nick & Nora glass.

drinkName.name: Tea & Sympathy
drinkName.about: Forget the whiskey. This warming Toddy replaces the brown spirit with cachaça laced with chai and spicy ginger liqueur.

mix.how: Soak one tea bag in a half mug of hot water for 30 seconds.
Remove the tea bag, add the rest of the ingredients and top with more hot water.
Garnish with lemon wheel stuffed with four to five cloves and a cinnamon stick.

drinkName.name: Patrinos
drinkName.about: Give your winter Toddy a Greek vacation by adding Tentura, a Greek liqueur spiced with cinnamon, nutmeg and cloves.

mix.how: Place two ounces of the Tentura liqueur into the mug and add the hot brewed coffee.
Stir in the steamed milk and top with two tablespoons of the foam.
Sprinkle with ground cinnamon.

drinkName.name: Thistle
drinkName.about: Cardamaro’s spice and nuttiness are perfect complements to the fresh apple flavor of the Calvados and warming spice of the rye whiskey in this cold weather cocktail.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice.
Stir, and strain into a footed rocks glass.

drinkName.name: More Cowbell
drinkName.about: Bitter amaro bites through this otherwise “spritzy” drink, made with gin, Aperol and silky gum syrup.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Martini glass.
Garnish with lemon peel.

drinkName.name: Fall to Pieces
drinkName.about: The spirit-forward nature of this cocktail makes it perfect for enjoying slowly by the fireside.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled coupe.
Garnish with oils expressed from an orange peel.

drinkName.name: Stranger in the Alps
drinkName.about: This riff on the Negroni features an Italian alpine amaro that adds a minty, pine essence to this fall cocktail.

ingredients.ingredient: Clear Creek Douglas Fir Eau de Vie

mix.how: Rinse a rocks glass with Douglas Fir Eau de Vie.
Combine remaining ingredients in a shaker with ice.
Shake, and strain over fresh ice into the rocks glass.
Garnish with a lemon pigtail.

drinkName.name: Hobnail
drinkName.about: Smoky Scotch is tempered with a hint of bitter amaro and a slick of spicy ginger syrup in this straightforward glass.

mix.how: Combine all ingredients in a shaker with ice.
Shake, and strain over fresh ice in a rocks glass.
Garnish with oils expressed from an orange peel.

drinkName.name: Rudolph’s Nose
drinkName.about: Anchor’s Christmas Spirit is the merry result of distilling Anchor Brewing’s Christmas ale, which creates a smooth, winter-spiced spirit that’s ideal for holiday cocktails like this one, mixed with maraschino, cognac and bitters.

ingredients.ingredient: Chateau Montifaud Pineau de Charentes Rosso

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice.
Stir, and strain into a coupe glass.
Garnish with a Luxardo cherry.

drinkName.name: Snow Bunny
drinkName.about: Anchor’s Christmas Spirit is the merry result of distilling Anchor Brewing’s Christmas ale, which creates a smooth, winter-spiced spirit that’s ideal for holiday cocktails like this one, mixed with ginger liqueur, honey syrup and allspice bitters.

mix.how: Add all ingredients except for the ale and bitters to a cocktail shaker.
Dry shake, then add ice and shake again.
Double-strain into a fizz glass and top with ale.
Garnish with shaved nutmeg and three drops of bitters.

drinkName.name: Embarcadero
drinkName.about: Meet the trifecta of perfectly balanced, bittersweet flavor: amaro, sweet vermouth and rye.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a rocks glass over large ice cube.
Garnish with a lemon peel.
